Body:
Description: Running a POC where all the NEA POC Collection jobs are coming back with the same error
17/03/2025 15:36:12	ERROR	ADP	TManagedDCExtractItf.PrepareForTask	"Unable to cast object of type 'System.String' to type 'System.Byte[]'"	LEWDC001	DCExtract	8904	8812	6244

In the same POC I am able run FS, SP and File Systems jobs no problem. All reports are available with expectation we can’t login to the Published reports directory which we have another support case open for. 
The MSSQL Database is US Version with a MSSQL Latin version on the collation and it looks fine. If it was Collation problem I would have seen that within the AD Inventory, FS and Sharepoint Online scans. 
The AIC is working as expected but the NEA AD {Permission analyser jobs are throwing the same issue as displayed above.
What We've Learned Updated: Invalid time zone. Moving to Tech Support Queue.
What We've Learned Updated: Invalid time zone. Sent initial email requesting logs and moving to T1 queue

Description Updated: Running a POC where all the NEA AD Permission Analyzer Collection Jobs report the same error

In the same POC I am able run FS, SP and File Systems jobs no problem. All reports are available with expectation we can’t login to the Published reports directory which we have another support case open for. 
The MSSQL Database is US Version with a MSSQL Latin version on the collation and it looks fine. 
If it was Collation problem, I would have seen that within the AD Inventory, FS and Sharepoint Online scans. 
The AIC is working as expected but the NEA AD {Permission analyser jobs are throwing the same issue as displayed above.
I am still unable to upload the Collection logs on the SharePoint Web Site, PLease help

Hi Team,

 

Please see comments below in RED

 

What steps to troubleshoot the issue have already been taken? Repaired the application

Is this a new configuration, data collection or report? This is a new deployment part of a POC

If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 

When did this issue start?  From the start of the POC which was 11th March 2025
Please NOTE MSSQL is running on a separate server. I have also uploaded the Log Files from the AD Permissions Analyzer Collection scan jobs in debug mode.
Note i have also uploaded more Log Files and Exports of the jobs to the SharePoint Site
Any Updates on this please ? i have sessions with Executive Management next week to close the POC down and i need this working !!!
Issue has been resolved now. There seems to be an issue with the account we where using to run the scans. Please close down Support Case

Hi All this is a bit embarrassing but i need to reopen this ticket. The partner connected me to the incorrect environment when i did the checks yesterday. I just assumed the screen he shared was the correct NEA POC. There was a change in the engineer i was working with which created the confusion. I waiting to have another session now to see whats going on.

 

I think it is best we have someone from support join a call @Rejaul Uddin​ 

 

Please can we re-open this support case. Apologies for the confusion.

@Mike Candon​ @Rejaul Uddin​  please update the ticket summary here

Next Steps Updated: +++++
2025_0326: Suggested Next Steps:
+++++

1) As a test, can we use a Domain Admin cred on the ADPA Collection jobs --does this throw the same error?

2) I would like to see evidence/screenshots that the POCNetwrix account has at least the following permissions on the root of the domain/all AD objects
Read
Read permissions
LDAP Read

3) Also might not hurt to try and run the attached PS script as POCNetwrix from the NEA console server --does this succeed?

4) Another option is try pulling a new copy of the group from instant solutions

Steps to Reproduce Updated: 1) Use MS SQL Server Authentication for Settings > Storage in NEA.
2 Use an Active Directory Account for Settings > Connection to run the Active Directory Permissions Analyzer jobs.   
3) Prerequisites are that the ".Active Directory Inventory" and "Active Directory" job groups have run successfully.

For tiger team.

Pretty similar to the other issue.

Customer will be reviewing permissions based on this document.

Just confirming there is nothing else required.

ADPermissions Data Collector
